client_updates.highlight: Besu: BAL optimizations complete, max item check and uniqueness implemented
Besu and Geth ready for benchmarking with batch I/O toggles
Besu implemented JSON RPC BAL endpoint for DevNet3

testing_progress.highlight: Benchmark tests blocked: need one client with testing_buildBlockV1 endpoint for Glamsterdam
Benchmarks require mainnet state; empty state tests insufficient for batch I/O
Tests added for BAL uniqueness and ordering validation

fork_status_and_schedule.highlight: Batch I/O benchmarks prioritized: needed for both Glamsterdam repricing and BAL state location decision

specifications.highlight: Merged: STF clarification - BAL hash verification without passing full BAL to STF
Merged: Simplified max item check accounting for free system contract entries
EELS implementation debate: max item check placement in specs vs security considerations

partial_statefulness.highlight: Proposal: Use BAL to transmit account hash diffs (64 bytes per changed account)
Partial stateful nodes would store address→account_hash mapping (~10GB for 300M accounts)

action_items.action: Implement testing_buildBlockV1 endpoint supporting Glamsterdam EIPs for benchmark filling
action_items.owner: One client team (preferably Nethermind or EELS)

action_items.action: Clarify EELS specs placement of max item check and remaining gas validation
Evaluate BAL bloat impact from adding 64-byte account hash diffs for partial statefulness
